messages.message: Quick update: I’ve just uploaded a new draft for the anomaly overlay user guide to Confluence. Please review: https://confluence.nvidia.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=998877.

replies.message: Thanks, James. I’ll check it out and add any comments on the UI recommendations.
I’ll focus on the technical details and flag any gaps in the anomaly examples.

messages.message: I’ve found a potential optimization for the bounding box alignment process. It reduces latency by about 12%.

replies.message: That’s a significant improvement! Could you document the changes and share the benchmarks?
Does this also address the jitter issue in high-traffic simulations?
Yes, it seems to stabilize the jitter significantly in those scenarios.

messages.message: I’ve updated the QA test case tracker with the latest edge cases for bounding box anomalies: https://notion.nvidia.com/retail-safety/qa-tracker. Let me know if I missed anything.

replies.message: Thanks, Maria. I’ll cross-check this with the bug list from last week’s trials.
We should prioritize testing these during the next QA cycle.

messages.message: Has anyone started drafting the retrospective for the Dallas deployment prep?

replies.message: I’ve noted some key points about model performance improvements. I’ll add them to the draft.
I’ll contribute insights from the QA feedback we received yesterday.

messages.message: Do we need to loop in the product team for feedback on the anomaly overlay design changes?

replies.message: Yes, let’s sync with them during their Tuesday meeting.
I’ll prepare a slide summarizing the changes and potential impacts for that meeting.

messages.message: I’ve started running stress tests for the updated model on Jetson Xavier NX. Results should be ready by morning.
Let us know if any new bottlenecks show up. I can help debug if needed.
Are we also validating the fallback mechanism’s integration during these tests?
Yes, I’ve included that in the testing scope. I’ll flag any issues I encounter.
